Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: loulou112Australia
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful. Great to have an apartment so centrally located in the CBD. Nice to have a separate bedroom but there's no tv in the bedroom and the tv in the living room was old. There's no gym in the building but they will organise passes for you elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: BobGloucester
Reviews.Content: These apartments are in an excellent location between the QVB and Darling Harbour. It is a high building in a fairly quiet street for central Sydney, so noise is not a problem. The apartments are basic but with comfortable beds and most of the essentials, including washing machine and tumble drier (even detergent was provided). The staff were extremely helpful. There is a cafe downstairs and room-service available but with Darling Harbour and Westfield Shopping Centre both 5 minutes away, there are plenty of eateries. Woolworth's supermarket is about 10 minutes away on foot, near Town Hall. There was no balcony or view but if you are going to spend most of your time out and about, Mantra on Kent is ideal at a competitive price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and pleasant hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Loekken
Reviews.Content: Mantra on Kent "did" our 12-days stay in Sydney! Our room was very pleasant with cleaning every day except one because of the the Easter. Pluss for washing machine and dryer. The straff was very nice, especially Josie, who really was a wonderful receptionist :) The location was excellent: In walking distance to Darling Harbour, Sydnwy Aquarium, Chinatown, Chinese Garden, Paddys Market, Westfield, Sydney Tower Eye and even Sydney Operahouse and Royal Botanic Garden. The only thing we did not like was that the internet access was too expensive. This should have been free/or at much less cost, especially because of our need for both internet booking of tours/events and also online access to our flights etc. LÃ¸kken family from Langhus, Norway

Reviews.Title: “delightful small gem”
Reviews.Author: travellingMs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mantra for 3 nights over the Easter break. The check in was excellent, efficient and the young lady was charming, helpful and accommodating when I asked for a high floor with a view. With a smile, she told me with refreshing honesty that the views were more 'glimpses' but she could give us floor 25. Was that okay? The apartment was modern, large, nicely presented, with full kitchenette, king bed, lounge area and table & chairs. Abundant light from many windows, most of which did in fact afford much more than a glimpse of Darling Harbour. The bathroom was quite large and efficient with the inclusion of washing machine & dryer. The bedroom can be closed off from the main area by closing large sliding doors. One minor criticism - a relatively small LCD TV . Very pleasant bar/breakfast restaurant on first floor if you choose it - we made breakfast in our apartment at our leisure. The location is sensational! 1 small block from all the eating,drinking and festivities of Darling Harbour, and similar distance to the Queen Vic Building, central city and Town Hall railway station. Pleasant walking distance from Circular Quay and the Rocks for exploring on foot. Many wonderful pubs & small 7/11 style shops to buy in your breakfast requirements in close proximity.We had no car but there is a parking station next door - you would need to check the rates. We have travelled to Sydney frequently over recent years and wish we had found the Mantra on Kent years ago. We will definitely be back. Take a ferry trip to Watson's Bay for lunch - top tier of the pub with barra & wine overlooking the water - not to be missed!!

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING TO FAULT”
Reviews.Author: Ray170
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at this hotel to celebrate our anniversary whilst seeing the John Cleese show in the State Theatre. We could not fault the hotel in any way. The Reception staff were cheerful and friendly and the room first class. We were on the 26th floor with a pleasant view over Cockle Bay (?)

Reviews.Title: “Apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: Napier1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in late March, clean room average service from staff

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Excellent Position.”
Reviews.Author: suedill
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay at the Mantra on Kent on March 25th. It is a great hotel right in the heart of Sydney but you wouldn't even know it once you step in the door. The girl at reception was super friendly and helpful with tips about local restaurants and attractions. Our room was tastefully decorated, very clean and spacious . It was equipped with a small cooktop, full oven,microwave and fridge. And even had a washing machine and dryer in the bathroom. So was ideal for an even longer stay. It was only an easy 7 minute walk over the Pyrmont Bridge to Harbourside at Darling Harbour, a 4 minute walk to The Queen Victoria Building and 5 minutes to Townhall Station. As well as easy walking to theatres and major shopping centres in the CBD. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Sue B
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroomed apartment for our week in Sydney. The staff were very welcoming on our arrival, and continued to help us with their knowledge of the environment, ie closest supermarket, where to catch buses etc. The apartment could not have been better - full kitchen, large bathroom, excellent laundry, roomy lounge/dining, and comfy bedroom. Very quiet - despite being located on a busy street we could hear little traffic noise unless we opened a window. Five minutes walk to Darling Harbor (Cockle Bay) and five minutes walk to Town Hall Rail Station and Woolies supermarket! Would certainly both recommend to all my friends plus return there next time I am lucky enough to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Physim
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in a studio apartment for business. Location was very close to Cockle Wharf and the city centre. The apartment was very roomy and clean and modern. It had a bath and shower and a washing machine and dryer, a fridge, hairdryer, Sink, Microwave, oven cooktop, king size bed, tv with free to air and some pay channels and a DVD player. The sofa could sleep a 3rd person and there was enough crockery cutlery and glassware for 3. The satff were very friendly and always helpful. Breakfast was $15 for a buffet which was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value location in CBD”
Reviews.Author: Girl_from_Gumble
Reviews.Content: We booked a family suite (two separate rooms with a central entrance foyer), which gave plenty of room for a couple, baby, and two friends - it also meant the babysitter could relax and watch TV in one room while the baby slept in the adjoining room. Location is close to Cockle Bay and the attractions of Darling Harbour, shopping in QVB/city and trains at Town Hall Station. Secure parking very reasonable at the parking station next door ($12/day on weekends). Full kitchen and laundry included in suite, so great for a longer stay family break.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Christine M
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 adults stayed in connecting roomsn 24th floor where a single entrance branched off into 2 units: thus we were able to close off each room for privacy when needed. The room my husband, myself and my adult son shared was very roomy and I particularly liked the fact that we could screen our bed with sliding glass doors for a bit of extra privacy. The rooms were spacious as was the bathroom; appointments modern but comfortable. The location was excellent: 2 minutes to Darling Harbour and China Town and 2 minutes to Westfield and the heart of the shopping precinct. The staff were extremely obliging and helpful: even processing our airport check-in for us. As it was a short trip (2 nights) to attend a wedding, we didnt have the opportunity to dine in-house but I investigated the restaurant and it appeared very welcoming. I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneNicky
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in early March. We arrived quite some hours before the official checkin time, and the reception staff happily stored our bags and then later rang to confirm our room was ready. During our stay the staff were lovely and ever so helpful - their service, smiles and attitudes were great. The location is terrific, it's a very easy walk to Darling Harbour, monorail stop, ferries and so on. Our room was a one bedroom apartment, and it was a bit plain and dreary - nothing to rave about but it was satisfactory and a decent sized space, and clean and tidy. Slight hiccup one morning - I was sitting in bed and thought I heard something at the door, and a male staff member then walked in - we both got a bit of a surprise but he hastily departed. Perhaps a very loud knock might have been better then what was instead a fairly quiet entry.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Mantra on Kent”
Reviews.Author: Shane C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mantra on Kent three times in the last few years and found the hotel to be consistently good The staff are friendly, knowledgeable and willing to assist guests in pretty much everything from getting a taxi to finding a late night pharmacy at short notice, and are genuinely interested in helping the guests make the most of their stay. Thee rooms are spacious and reasonably well appointed, although starting to show their age in patches - the hotel was opened in 99 in advance of the Sydney 2000 olympics. None of the rooms I have stayed in have had a Minibar - a small refrigerator does have milk, but no ice tray - there are no ice machines on the floors, however the staff will bring up ice if requested. Where the mini bar is missing, it is important to note, that there are many bars, convenience stores and bottleshops open late in and around the immediate area, so this shouldn't cause a problem to most guests. In the rooms I have stayed, there have been a washer and dryer, which at the end of a multi-leg trip can be a real bonus, particularly when inclement weather causes you to use more changes of clothes than you were planning. One gripe I did have was the King bed in my room was made up of two king singles, which had been bound together - I found the hard centre of the bed was disturbing to sleep on, and I found my rest not as good as it could have been.

Reviews.Title: “Mantra On Kent”
Reviews.Author: rayjan669
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5 nights at Mantra on Kent we booked through Club.CuSoon and in doing so we had a one bedroom apartment at an unbelivable price.We did not have a view of Darling Harbour but we didn't expect one at this price we were on the 26th floor as we requested a higher level.Our room was spacious,well equipped and serviced daily. Location is fantastic we enjoyed the Chinese Fireworks at 9pm after a Valentines Dinner at Darling Harbour and felt very safe walking the short distance back to the Mantra The staff at reception were so friendly & professional ( especially Carla) and made us very welcome we would recommend you stay its great value for money R & J Yeppoon Qld

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: chrisalberta
Reviews.Content: We arrived after an overnight flight from Canada to a warm and welcoming reception. Our room was a one bedroom apartment that was spacious, well furnished and had a well equipped kitchen. The location is absolutely great-just around the corner from Darling Harbour (we particularly enjoyed meals at Zaaffran and Georges),two supermarkets close by and just a short walk to pedestrian shopping area. I would recommend the Hop on Hop off bus to give you a good orientation to the City including a stop at Bondi Beach. Also the boat trip from Darling Harbour to Watsons Bay gives you a fantastic view of Sydney from the water.Finally we had occasion to contact the hotel a few days after we left and they were most helpful-Thanks to Elena.

Reviews.Title: “Our review of Mantra on Kent St”
Reviews.Author: Robert R
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by the very friendly concierge at the hotel. They really made us feel welcome and valued as customers. For me this is one of the most important things about visiting the hotels. We were upgraded to the penthouse for our anniversary which made our night extra special. Comfortable bed, and massive balconies. Really enjoyed our stay here and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, quiet and not pokey. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jan c
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Mantra on Kent Australia Day and were delighted to be upgraded to a room overlooking Darling Harbour on 20th Floor. This was perfect for me as I intended staying in my room to watch the tennis while my husband wanted to walk Sydney looking at the NRMA Motorfest cars. We both have things we love to do on Australia Day. We had booked a 1 bedroom apartment for a bit of extra room and although spacious and the doors can be slid around the bed to give the room complete privacy do not expect a full apartment. The kitchen was really a large kitchenette with a small bar fridge. It was ok for us for 1 night but I would not have wanted to spend more time trying to cook meals in it. Just a tad too small. Having said that it was all very clean and there was enough equipment to prepare a adaquate meal. I must say I do not like the shower over the bath but with a hand from my husband managed to get in for a lovely shower. If you are unsteady on your feet make sure you book something with a seperate shower. Our bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet. Being Australia Day I expected that there would be a lot of noise but it was really quiet. An added bonus we could open the windows in the main room and get fresh air into the room hence not having tor run the air conditioner. We really did have a lovely stay and the staff were helpful and we felt welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: sueandal
Reviews.Content: We only had two days in Sydney, so really wanted to make the most of it. Mantra on Kent was perfectly situated to explore the Darling Harbour area. The Hotel is within walking distance of all sorts of attractions such as Darling Harbour itself, the monorail, Aquarium, Paddys Market, lots of dining options, various harbour tours, shopping and much, much more. Could easily have spent a week exploring the area. We found the rooms comfortable and clean with all the usual self contained features like kitchen, washing machine and dryer. The staff were very helpful and provided us with information about the local tourist attractions and transport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: joanna j
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mantra on Kent for the weekend. Loved it! Spacious room with a balcony, really helpfull staff, loved the food and loved the location! It was absolutly everything my family and I needed for a weekend in the city. The hotel was clean, safe and had a warm feeling about it. I would absolutly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect night!”
Reviews.Author: RigbyL86
Reviews.Content: Organised a night out for my birthday and was able to get 2 rooms at the Mantra. Perfect and central location to everything in the city, and great service checking in and out to make things a lot easier. The rooms were big and spacious and had everything you would need. With Wilsons Parking right next door at great weekend overnight rates, we couldn't have asked for a better night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: AnneCWP
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. They certainly did their best to inform us of what we needed to know whenever we asked. We were on the top floor with a great view of Darling Harbour. Only a couple of minutes walk to the Harbour. A very spacious and clean room with a full kitchen. Also nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and there might be a view”
Reviews.Author: Matilda F
Reviews.Content: Plus: Suprisingly I got a room with a view to Darling Harbour (On NYE!). Spacious room, well equipped full kitchen. Quiet (except for one day where people on my floor had a family gathering in the hall). Plenty of seating in the room and hotel in good location. Minus: Surprising for Australia, the staff knew nothing regarding tourist staff or NYE spots.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: shellz1965
Reviews.Content: Mantra on kent is a great place to stay. It is just around the corner from darling harbour bridge, transport and shops. Our room was serviced every day, and we really have no complaints. I love the mantra chain!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but cleanliness is questionable”
Reviews.Author: WandSLtd
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Mantra on Kent after reading the reviews on Medina vs Mantra. I am usually a fan of Medina but went with Mantra after the glowing reviews and also the fact that the Medina may be going through renovations. Loved the location of the Mantra. So close to everything! However, as we were there with our 17mth old toddler, I was not impressed with the dirty floors in the bathroom and kitchen/lounge area. I took a swipe with a cotton wool and it was black! Did not feel like it was ever cleaned. Made me wonder about the cleanliness of the carpets! Overall it was ok, spacious and convenient. But will be going back to Medina next time!

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay and still fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Teglian
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed here and it's my favorite place to stay in Sydney. Close to everything, staff are fantastic and room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Anne C”
Reviews.Author: Anne C
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself have just returned from a 9 day break at the Mantra on Kent travelling from Perth. We were very impressed by the apartment we were allocated. It was on the 21st floor and we had a view of the harbour. It was very clean and very well equipped for an extended stay. The reception staff were very knowledgeable and very helpful. The apartments are in an excellent position and close to many attractions that Sydney has to offer. It was very close to many restaurants and shopping malls which we made good use of. We will certainly be staying at the Mantra on future visits to Sydney and would not hesitate to recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and quiet enivronment.”
Reviews.Author: Peter F
Reviews.Content: We were put into a large "apartment" style unit with a large kitchen/dining/lounge room, a separate bedroom and then another "office/work" room (which was ideal to put the cases and other items) with a separate full laundry and bathroom off that. Very comfortable unit with a balcony ( view was just the other side of the street which in the main appeared to be offices etc which are closed in the weekend ) - carpet getting a bit wrinkly in one part, but overall a well equipped and clean unit in a quiet street with convenience stores and some food outlets very close by. A nice quiet unit in Very conveniently located near Darling Harbour.(near the Pyrrmont Bridge and mono rail.) All staff we dealt with were cheerful, very courteous and helpful.l Check in and out were both nice and quick. Would stay there again. Very trivial matters and raised with staff when we left - there was only one face flannel and no plug for the kitchen sink. I am sure that would have been remedied.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive Advertisement”
Reviews.Author: Brodie W
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Mantra on Kent with some friends. When sent up to our room we were briefed on the layout of our "two bedroom apartment" by the lady on the front desk who made it sound like it was two rooms but that they had joining doors - not a two bedroom apartment but we figured it would be ok anyway. When we reached the rooms we found that in actual fact they were two separate rooms, with two separate keys and no ajoinging door but instead a shared foyer and no door stop s to even hold the doors open. I called down to reception to request the two bedroom apartment we had asked for and was told that they dont actually have two bedroom apartments. This meant that for the weekend get away, one of us had to sleep by themselves the whole time. Even the "one bedroom apartment" doesn't actually have a bedoom, it has doors that are supposed to make a wall. Very misleading. in addition, the sofa we used only had a thin blanket and I woke up cold on several occasions during the night. The positives were the room service, which was very good, the location, which was excellent and the hotel staff, who were nice. Just dont be fooled by the false advertising - the Mantra on Kent does not have two bedroom apartments!

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: amap30
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated, close to everything in the city center (Darling Harbour, Convention Center, Sky Tower, Fish Market, etc). The ratio quality /price is very good also. Rooms are pleasant and quiet, beds are comfortable. Breakfast very pleasant as well. A good choice to visit Sydney if you have no rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Mantra on Kent”
Reviews.Author: Claire S
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Mantra on Kent for an extended weekend trip to Sydney from Perth staying for 5 nights. We had our 2 year old son with us and found the hotel & staff to be extremely family friendly, clean and super helpful. The location is perfect for sightseeing & shopping and the staff are more than happy to order a taxi if your destination is further away. The apartment was a good size and had all the requirements needed for travelling with a small child. We would definetley recommend the Mantra on Kent to family & friends and will stay there again on our next trip to Sydney. We will also look out for the Mantra group in other places we may visit.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay again”
Reviews.Author: Lyn M
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating my sons birthday in Sydney, and decided to stay overnight. Mantra on Kent is a great location and such friendly staff. On check-in they told us about saving money on the car park which is right next door. All requests were actioned straight away. The breakfast deal is well worth the $15 pre paid. With two big strong boys to keep fed, they enjoyed going up to the hot and cold buffet numerous times. We will be planning to go to Sydney again before Xmas and make sure we stay at Kent Street. Thank you for making us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Amie788
Reviews.Content: My husbund and I stayed here December 2010, it was the start of our honeymoon and the start of a month long trip to Australia. The apartment was in a great location, just a 5 minute walk to Darling Harbour which is great for restaurants in the evening. The apartment was a really good size and you had your own washing machine and tumbledrier as well as a fully equipped Kitchen. The staff were really helpful, I lost my key for my padlock on my suitcase and one of the members of staff came up to our apartment with a hacksaw. I would definately stay here again and it was great to have an apartment in Sydney as meant you could prepare and have food in the apartment rather then eating everything out which saved us a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location very good value”
Reviews.Author: Monetgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days while attending a conference at the Sheraton darling harbor. Studio room was more than adequate. Large room and good basic cooking facilities. Cleanliness was top rate. Good linen. Bed was comfy enough but probably should be replaced soon. Staff were helpful and $15 breakfast was easy and affordable. Good location. Easy Walk to darling Barbour and city. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Did the job"”
Reviews.Author: jackal58
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights. Liked that the lower level apartments had a balcony. Rooms need an upgrade, new stylish furniture and NEW blankets & sheets. Service was fine. Wifi expensive but seems to be the status quo in Oz. Did not get around to eating in the restaurant. Easy walk to mono rail or Town hall train station under QVB Building. Great central location for cbd and Darling harbour.

Reviews.Title: “this was a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: polly5090
Reviews.Content: close to everything,monorail, rail station, darling harbour, shopping and not expensive. the room was more than big enough for 3 adults, great shower, clean and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to city CBD and Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: NicoleS89
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the very top room complete with 2 balconies plus a rooftop terrace all to ourselves, which gave us fantastic views! About a 5-10 min walk to city shopping and even closer to darling Harbour! We stayed in a one bedroom apartment complete with full kitchen and great clothes washing/drying facilities. Bathroom was good, only fault was there was no fan/vent so after showers the bathroom became very steamy and therefore condensation was everywhere! Tried to open the window but didn't seem to help much. Staff were very friendly and helpful and overall it was a great stay. I would definitely recommend to friends/family and wouldnt hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Beryl W
Reviews.Content: We have never met such friendly, helpful staff both at Reception and in the restaurant which we used for breakfast a couple of times. They couldn't do enough for us. We arrived on a very early flight so couldn't check in straight away but the staff looked after our luggage behind the reception counter while we went exploring and managed to get our room ready a couple of hours early. Our one bedroom apartment was quite spacious and kept spotlessly clean with daily servicing. Clean towels provided every day.We had a minor problem with the oven but that was fixed immediately. The location was great - just 5 minutes walk to Darling Harbour where the Sydney Aquarium, Sydney Wildlife and Monorail are situated along with lots of restaurants. The ferries also leave from there. Also about 30 minutes walk (although might be less if you're more mobile than me!!) from Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House and Central Station in the opposite direction. 10 minutes walk to the Sydney Tower and Westfield shopping centre so everything you could want on the doorstep. The hotel don't provide parking and I think it's about $10AUD per day in the car park next door but we didn't want to drive in Sydney anyway. There's a free bus (555) that goes along the main street to Sydney Harbour and the Circular Quay area and the trains are very good for getting outside the city. We took a 2 hour train ride to the Blue Mountains which was very reasonably priced. If we ever go back to Sydney we'll definitely stay in the same hotel and would happily try one of their others in a different location.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location for most places EXCEPT where we needed to go”
Reviews.Author: TaffTraveller_11
Reviews.Content: Good quality central hotel with everything we needed in the room. Comfortable and well set out. Restaurant downstairs seem a bit minimalistic and the hotel staff we spoke to seemed to struggle with the English language. Only real complaint was that we had booked this hotel as part of a package deal to see Hairspray.. Now, thats a long way from the hotel -in the casino, and you would have thought the hotel could have organised transport. Hotel staff seemed unwilling/unable to organise a taxi for us.

Reviews.Title: “On the Money”
Reviews.Author: Kosta100
Reviews.Content: Was travelling on business. Hotel is in great location and is quite good value for the money. Annoys me that so many hotels still charge additional fees for wi-fi/broadband internet useage. Breakfast was average. Staff were friendly. Overall I would stay there again mainly for the location which which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: kiwi47
Reviews.Content: We have just reurned from a stay at the Mantra on Kent. We have stayed at the Mantra hotel in Melbourne on numerous occasions but this hotel falls short on our experiences there. The one bedroom is not a separate bedroom but a glass partition, making it more of a studio really. Annoying if you want to stay up later than your companion as the noise and light filters through. Storage is lacking and there is nowhere to put even one suitcase in the bedroom. My biggest gripe was the heating system was not working properly and we had the maintenance man there daily. This was during some very cold days.Then the replacement portable heater didn't work. I realised later that four wall plugs weren't functioning, probably due to a blown fuse that wasn't fixed. There is no dishwasher in the suite and we found dirty glasses in the cupboard. Another gripe was the lack of towels, facecloths and no hand towel in the bathroom. I requested more but we received them on just one day of our stay. The positives were the location. very close to the city shopping, Darling Harbour and train station.We were given a high floor apartment as requested and the room was quiet. The breakfast at $20 was substantial. Would we stay here again....probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Quality modern apartment in great location”
Reviews.Author: AprilInVietnam
Reviews.Content: Our studio apartment appeared to be near new and was tastefully decorated and immaculately clean. Plenty of room and a nice view at an angle of Darling Harbour. No problem with noise despite the inner city location possibly thanks to being near the top of the building. Congratulations to the hotel staff who were always pleasant and very helpful especially the new trainee on reception. Very convenient location. A bargain through wotif. Breakfast was a bit expensive so we went elsewhere. Overall....highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “very central, large comfortable self contained rooms”
Reviews.Author: FridayOnMyMindSydney
Reviews.Content: walking distance to the CBD attractions, quite street

Reviews.Title: “Lifted by its location”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneD_001
Reviews.Content: The Mantra on Kent is a serviceable apartment hotel, nothing special, but given a lift by its location. It's close to Darling Harbour (my room had a nice view down into the Maritime Museum) and to Sydney's main shopping areas, especially the Queen Victoria Building. There are plenty of cafes, bars and restaurants nearby. The staff were friendly and did their best to accommodate a late check-out despite being full for the following night. On the plus side, the room was spacious for a studio apartment and the kitchen was well-equipped. The bed was also more comfortable than is usually found in a hotel. On the down side, the wardrobe and drawer space was small and cramped (the drawers were *in* the wardrobe, taking up half of it), with the bed jammed up against the door. The bathroom had a clothes dryer but no washing machine, as advertised on the website. There is only pay internet in the lobby and restaurant, so it wasn't very convenient for business. The breakfast buffet selection wasn't very extensive and was overpriced, but the food was nice enough. There's no real reason to breakfast there with lots of cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I'll stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: rollingstone7795
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Sydney every 6 months and we always stay here. The apartments are spacious and well equipped, wheather you are staying 1 night, or for a week. The staff are so friendly and genuine and always up for a chat. They even remembered that we played golf as there was a golfing magazine in our apartment when we arrived. Now thats attention to detail. The brekkie is delicious and a little to hard not to overindulge. The friendly staff and central location keeps us coming back time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, price and rooms- just dont expect a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MerlsWA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mantra on Kent for 5 nights to attend a friendâ€™s wedding in Sydney. I booked an apartment as my wife and 8 month old son were planning to stay, unfortunately I was here by myself. The room price was excellent given the location, which is ideal. Whilst not directly on a major road giving some quiet, it is very central to almost everything in the CBD. On arrival no one offered to help me with my bags- I find this really annoying. The staff however were generally very helpful with any queries I had. The room, given the location, was excellent. Iâ€™m not saying this is a luxury 5 star room, but certainly more than adequate. The room had a living area, bedroom, kitchen, laundry and bathroom (with a bath). Whilst breakfast was not included in room price, the hotel does offer a morning buffet. Unfortunately there is no gym, pool or business centre- but given the price of the room I certainly would not have expected one. I was however very disappointed with the price of internet from the room- astronomical! Overall however I was very pleased given the price of this hotel. Travelling as a couple with a young infant this would be ideal, and I certainly see myself returning.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location & great apartment”
Reviews.Author: EJK80
Reviews.Content: I can't fault the Mantra on Kent. Its so close to the main shops and Darling Harbour in Sydney, we even had a Harbour view from our window. The apartments are modern, clean and well equipped. We stayed here for 7 nights and were able to cook full meals with the equipment provided. Staff were also helpful. Highly recommended, especially for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: Rturo69
Reviews.Content: We spent our last three nights in Sydney here and what a mistake. Location was great and the staff were good tobget us into our roan as soon as they could, we arrived very early off a overnight flight. Found the bed to be horribly uncomfortable and squeaky. Only one bed side lamp. Tv on opposite side of room not near bed. Very thin walls, could hear the people next door, like they were in the same room. Very poor lighting in bathroom, and what's up with no hand towels, just small bath towels. I paid 170.00 a night and it was not worth it. Till this day no one has contacted me to discuss the issues.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average really”
Reviews.Author: JohnboyH
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sydney in a heatwave (41 degrees c) so were pleased that our room was ready to have a shower. The room had a view which looked out onto Darling Harbour between two tower blocks and was certainly clean enough. However, for some reason we had a tumble dryer in the bathroom but no washing machine (just a deep sink). Also, we bought some provisions, including breakfast cereal only to find no bowls in the room. We got them from reception staff who were friendly enough. darling Harbour is minutes away which was handy for the ferry to Circular Quay which in turn, led to other ferry routes. The hotel is of a reasonable standard but I don't believe it merits a 4-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little tired”
Reviews.Author: sueom
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Mantra on Kent for 4 nights over the New Year period and then returned for 1 night after having 3 days in the Hunter Valley. Our first room a 1 bed deluxe ( which is really a studio with a partitioned bed room was room 1004 on the 10th floor. Whilst the room was very clean it was very dated. The bathroom was tiny. The toilet was next to the bath, with the shower being over the bath and with the location of the shower screen it was very difficult to get into the shower. Elderly or infirm travellers should request not to have this room. Our 2nd room (also a 1 bedroom deluxe) was on the 25th floor and was much nicer with a lovely view, the bathroom was much bigger due to it not having a bath, it was a pity we only were in it for 1 night. The hotel staff were very helpful and courteous and the location to Darling Harbour is great. It isn't cheap to stay however .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring Sydney”
Reviews.Author: LSPAberdeen_Scotland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay in an apartment in Sydney for our stay over New Year to allow us a bit more independence than a hotel - great decision. The Mantra on Kent is in a fabulous location, literally on the doorstep of Darling Harbour and 20 minute leisurely walk to Circular Quay. There is a large Woolworths supermarket one block away and the David Jones department store, which is a 5/10 minute walk away, has an excellent luxury foodhall. The apartment itself was fairly basic - I would think 4* is pushing it a bit, more like 3 really. That aside it was a decent size; large living / dining area, fully equipped kitchen, decent size bathroom with a pretty good shower, utility area with decent washing machine and tumble dryer, smallish but adequate bedroom. Despite being so close to Darling Harbour, the area was quiet in the evenings and we always felt safe walking around. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable, although housekeeping were a bit too eager - some days turning up to service the apartment before 9am. Mantra on Kent would be a perfect choice for anybody visiting Sydney for the first time - couples, families or groups.

Reviews.Title: “funfilled holiday”
Reviews.Author: angiedr
Reviews.Content: Mantra on Kent was for us in the best location to the heart of the city. Our room being the the 24th floor was amazing with some great views. It was clean neat and tidy and very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IN AN AMAZING LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1989
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends & I stayed at the Mantra on Kent after a night out in the City - it's a 2 minute walk to Darling Harbour, right near the Slip Inn, Chinese Laundry and The Retro. The 1 Bedroom Apartment was perfect for us, only let down was that the room key was a bit stuffed and it took about 5 minutes to open the door. We will definitly be staying here for our next venture into Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Harry-Jezz
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights on a fly in fly out break away. Booked a fully self contained apartment on the 26th floor with some Darling Harbour views. This was a waste for us as we did'nt use the laundry or kitchen but good if you want to. Location was really central with every thing to fill your day and night within easy walking distance in any direction and safe. If you have a car there is parking right next door. Convenience stores close by and super market not far away. Monorail Station just round the corner.The apartment was spacious enough for lounge dining and sleeping with a king bed but dont take a lot of luggage as it wont fit in the bed room so we left it in the lounge dining area, it caused us no problem. The bathroom had a few cracked tiles which can happen with movement in older high rise buildings and should be replaced as part of an annual maintenance program along with abit of regrouting to freshen it up abit but no deterent from staying there. The staff were friendly and helpfull and the price we paid was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartments, perfect for a slightly longer stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: indigogrl
Reviews.Content: We asked for a room with a view and were given one but the 'view' of Darling Harbour was tenuous at best. However, that was a minor point as the apartment, overall, was great for our needs and was a great size. It was serviced daily and the cleaning staff did a great job. Staff on reception very helpful and knowledgeable about the city. Location great for Darling Harbour but other than a small shopping mall and a row of predictable restaurants and bars, there wasn't much else going on. Sydney isn't a huge city so most places easily accessible on foot or by train, nearest station is Town Hall, a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “We would highly recommend this hotel, nothing was too much trouble for the staff.”
Reviews.Author: RetiredAussies
Reviews.Content: We we were very impressed with the accommodation. Perfect for our needs for a 7 day stay with washing machine and dryer. Well equipped kitchen for those who require it but also a good room service for evening meals when too tired to venture out to one of the many nearby restaurants in Darling Harbour. A comfortable king sized bed and a quiet room on 24th floor which we found very clean and tidy and was serviced daily. The location was ideal and within walking distance of many of the attractions and only a short train ride into circular key. We would most definately come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, very quiet rooms - will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Roadtrippers80
Reviews.Content: Mantra on Kent was our choice of hotel for a 1 week business trip. The week was crazy busy, including working over the weekend, so we wanted somewhere really central but also super safe and quiet. We got all that from Mantra and more. I had a problem with the hairdryer in my room and the staff were incredibly efficient in sorting it our straight away. To sum up, my colleague and I would definitely stay here again and have found it to be the best of the last 4 Sydney CBD hotels we have stayed in. Goodvalue and you're within very easy walking distance of the main shopping streets, supermarket, good restaurants and the key business districts.

Reviews.Title: “Large, well-equipped apartment in the heart of Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: Hatsumura
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Mantra on Kent and enjoyed it a lot. The location is excellent, our apartment was surprisingly huge and well-equipped (living-dining room, kitchen, laundry and, of course, bedroom and bathroom). The front desk staff and room service were efficient, we even had our dishes washed. Minor issues: we noticed a few cracks in the walls and stain in the sofa. Also, in our first night, the room was very cold and we couldn't set the air conditioner to warm it, but they provided us with an electric heater the next day. Overall, it's very comfortable and a great base to explore this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “I was impressed....”
Reviews.Author: ACTKiwi
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during a "long" weekend over 2 days/nights. The service I received was warm and efficient. The apartment was huge but I would have preferred a separate bedroom rather than a "segregated bedroom area" which had two sliding doors - partially composed of frosted glass. I couldn't watch TV without the "lights" disturbing my wife and daughter in the "bedroom". For those who have extended stays the kitchen facilities would prove useful. The shower was great but I would have liked more handy towel rails. We managed to sleep well apart from some noise from the nearby monorail(there is a station just "round the corner" from the Mantra). Breakfast was a hot/cold buffet and "filled the spot nicely". The Mantra on Kent St is in an ideal location as far as access to Darling Harbour and the Queen Victoria Building shopping areas. Overall a good choice for us - the "Mantra" will be on our minds for future accommodation!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view.”
Reviews.Author: dustyhor
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if you are on a short term or long term trip. Rooms are well equipped, location is excellent, just minutes from Darling Harbour, George Street, Hyde Park and many other Sydney attractions. I'll recommend this place to anyone with a fitting budget. The only complain I have so far is the sofa that looks a little dirty and the in-room washing machine looks stained and not cleaned properly on the inside.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay at the Mantra again!”
Reviews.Author: chillibee
Reviews.Content: I arrived late morning and knowing the hotel room might not be ready, I asked if I could leave my luggage at the hotel. Not only did they found a room for me to check-in, they also offered an upgrade to a one-bedroom apartment. The apartment had views to the city and Darling Harbour and is more than comfortable for one person. The bedroom had sliding doors so when opened, it turns into a large studio apartment or it could be closed for privacy. The kitchen is well-equipped even though I didn't use the facility. The apartment also had a washing machine and dryer. Even though the hotel is in the middle of Sydney, I cannot hear the traffic from down below (my apartment was on the 13th floor). The hotel has a computer with Internet connection for guests use but the Assistant Manager help us checked in and printed our itineraries for our flight home. Now, that's service! Less than 5 minutes walk to Cockle Bay and in the other direction QVB, it is the perfect location for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: empress_joanna
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights for work; couldn't fault anything! I was given a studio room on the top (27th) floor, which for just me was perfect; a comfy bed, plenty of space to stretch out in and a decent bathroom. Service was also impeccable - front staff always very friendly and willing to help. It may not be smack in the centre of the city, but it's well located and a 10 or 15 minute walk got me to where I needed to go. I think, for Sydney, it was great value as well. Heartily recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, great space.”
Reviews.Author: Tracey P
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights here while on a long weekend in Sydney. The location was great, the room had lots of space (one bedroom apartment) and the breakfast in the cafe was a good price and was very enjoyable. Our daughter slept on the sofa bed which was made up for us and the baby slept in the cot which was also set up in the room. Beds comfortable and the laundry was a bonus with kids! Would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: spendtheinheritance
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week for 4 nights and could not fault the place. It was very clean and we were lucky enough to be on the top floor with a view of Darling Harbour between the office buildings. We had an evening room service meal which was so good I nearly licked the plate. Its an exellent place to walk to Darling Harbour, only about 3 minutes away and close to the train station and the monorail. The staff were friendly and helped with directions and ordered a taxi for us. The one and only fault I could say was that the bathroom seemed to have an exhaust fan going all the time which was a little noisy when we first went to bed but we soon forgot about it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value for money, brilliant location, extremely happy.”
Reviews.Author: NatPerth73
Reviews.Content: We visited Sydney for a wedding and stayed for 5nts at the Mantra on Kent. Hotel had been recommended to me and we were not disappointed. Fabulous location - central to Darling Harbour, the Bridge, Opera House, the Rocks and brilliant shops. Everything was a walk away. We stayed in the one bedroom deluxe apartment. Great kitchen facilities, comfy queen bed and bathroom had washing machine and dryer. Good sized room, enough for 2 adults and our nearly 2 yr old. They offer breakfast which we didn't have as plenty of cafes nearby. Great little Japanese cafe around the corner where we could have an early dinner. Staff were very helpful and welcoming. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: ricardofusball
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom apartment at Mantra on Kent with our 7 month year old daughter. Although the bedroom itself was small, the apartment itself was very roomy - a large living room with a full kitchen, laundry and bathroom. The standard of the room itself wasn't luxury, but at the price we paid we weren't expecting it to be. However it was clean and although we hardly used the kitchen, it was a much better standard than in many apartments we'd stayed in before. Our room had airconditioning, cable TV, internet access, microwave, oven, cooktop, fridge, washing machine & dryer. Our room was very quiet, which was great for big sleep-ins. The staff at the hotel were excellent, and particularly friendly. We were given a late checkout on the last morning free of charge, which was great with our baby. Mantra on Kent is in a great spot - only a couple of minutes walk into the CBD, and if you walk a couple of minutes the other way you hit Darling Harbour. Overall Mantra on Kent is a really good value apartment option in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneSalsa
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Mantra on Kent and I would definately stay here again. The first time was in a studio apartment as a solo female traveller and I felt very safe. This time, my husband and I booked a 1 bed apartment for two nights through their website and got quite a reasonable deal considering it was a late booking (champagne, buffet breakfast, late check out). The room was clean and very quiet with partial views to Darling harbour. It had a kitchen, lounge, washing machine in bathroom, shower only, king bed in a "room" which had opaque sliding doors if you wanted to close it off (we liked the concept but didnt actually use it). The rooms do face a lot of office blocks so are not very private if the sheer curtains are open. The room size was huge when comparing it with other Sydney hotel room of the same price (we've stayed in plenty over the years). The location if fantastic. Close to Queen Vic Building and Pitt st Mall for shopping, Chinatown for restaurants, Darling harbour for bars and ferrys, Town Hall Station for great train transport to anywhere in Sydney. George Street (three small blocks away) has lots of buses for transport around sydney including a free shuttle bus between Circular Quay and Central Station. Staff here are friendly and efficient. Check in and check out were quick and smooth and there always seems to be several staff working in reception. We had buffet breakfast every morning which was ok (not brilliant, not terrible). The lady who runs the breakfast room is a delight. All in all, good value for money in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, exceptional service, dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: Emma1975
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Mantra on Kent late on a Sunday evening and were welcomed curbside by a staff member to help us with our bags. After a few room changes, we finally got a suitable room (first one was too high - I hate lifts, the second had no bath or washing machine, and the third was OK, although it had no washing machine). We ordered room service on our first night and it was promptly delivered and was fairly tastey. We were disappointed with the room, not only was it quite dirty, we had booked a "1 bedroom" apartment, but it wasn't a one bedroom, it was really a studio with a funny sliding door around the bedroom. As we were travelling with our 8 month old, we really need 2 separate areas so she wouldn't be interupted while she slept. This room layout meant we pretty much had to go to sleep when she did. The "king" bed was actually 2 single matresses put together and you could feel the bump in the middle which made it quite uncomfortable. The kitchenette was adequate, with everything you needed to cook a meal, including pots, serving dishes, crockery, cuttlery, even a potato masher :) The room had a laundry, but no washing machine. On the first morning I asked if there was somewhere to do some washing, I was told I could use another room when I needed to. However, when I returned from my walk, there was a washing machine in the laundry which was great. The hot water, both in the bathroom and the kitchenette, took at least 10 minutes to start heating up. But once it came through it was fine and it never ran out. On our final night one of our neighbours decided to come home around 3am and start singing and carrying on, I called down to reception and someone was up knocking on their door within 5 minutes - another great customer service experience. We requested a late check out, which was granted for free until midday, but after this we would be charged $20/hour up until 3pm, and thereafter we would be charged a full day's rate. Needless to say we checked out at 3pm - another great service offered by this hotel. I would recommend this hotel, based on the location and customer service alone. However, the rooms do need a good clean, especially the curtains and carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: AbartAZ
Reviews.Content: We organized two deluxe rooms for friends and ourselves. We specifically choose the hotel as it advertised full laundry facilities and TV/DVD. We liked the room, however there was no washing machine. It has a laundry room and drier, just no machine. The staff informed us you had to "request" a washing machine and not all rooms have them. Also, the MovieLink and TV service was not functional and none of the remotes where working for the TV/DVD. Also be aware that the parking charges for the parking station are $40 per day. The sofa-bed was bent and sagging in the middle (my back is still not over it). There was no coffee machine either. I was embarrassed to have organized this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small apartment”
Reviews.Author: bweebschan
Reviews.Content: I stayed with two friends at Mantra on Kent on a last minute trip to Sydney. I actually made a reservation just the day before our arrival, and the confirmation for our one-bedroom apartment was quick and I was pleased to find out that they had a special promotion through their website-you stay three nights and pay for two only. Mantra is ideally located in the heart of the city, Darling Harbour is a short walk away, and you have good shops and eating places all around. Loved the location. The lobby was small and unimpressive, but the staff were very helpful and patient with our requests throughout our stay. Check-in was smooth and very quick. Was a little disappointed with the apartment at first to be honest, the lifts were old and noisy, our apartment much smaller and older than expected. Our bedroom in particular was tiny, there was barely any room apart from the bed, so we left our luggage in the living area and spent most of our time in the living/dining area. There was also a little kitchen, washing area and bathroom, all clean and functional. After a day or two I stopped noticing all the little flaws and actually felt that the place was cosy and comfortable, and certainly sufficient for all our needs. It was cleaned daily and we always had a good supply of bathroom paper and clean towels. On our last day, we requested if the reception could hold our luggage and parcels for an extra few hours after check-out as we had a late flight, and they were most accommodating. All in all a pleasant stay. While I will probably want to try out newer apartments if I do return to Sydney, I certainly had a comfortable time at the Mantra, and the location was perfect and the staff service very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: KJM_8
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at Mantra on Kent in a studio apartment and found it to be in a fantastic location, close to Darling Harbour and the City centre. The room was well equiped with a kitchen and very clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. My only complaint is the noise you can hear in the hallways, room to room they are sound proof but as soon as someone goes to the lift you can hear everything. Also the room doors are very heavy and slam each time someone comes and goes, which isn't pleasant at 6am.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: 247Travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very much in the three star range but given it's price and amenities, it represents excellent value. It is clean and tidy and it's proximity to Darling Harbour, the Queen Victoria Building and the railway station make it a good, reliable venue. Most rooms are apartments, some with balconies. There are no views of note as the building faces away from Darling Harbour. The views are of opposing buildings across the city or the skyline. The apartments are services daily, although dishes are not washed in the kitchen. The service seems to extend to making the bed and changing towels in the bathroom. The rooms are spacious with cable tv, dvd players and clock radio. A generous kichenette is provided with fridge, stove top & pots and pans. The bedroom is a little on the small side but with an ample wardrobe. The beds are comfortable with good linen. The Hotel has a restaurant that serves a basic breakfast. I've never dined in the hotel at night as the proximity to Darling Harbour means that all manner of options are just a short stroll away. The Mantra is not the Hilton but it isn't a dive either. It represents very good value for money. There are only two things to be weary of - the shower seems to offer only two temperatures, hot or cold. In addition, the irons need replacing as they are very old. Other than that, you can't really fault it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: glynnhesel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in early September 2008. We had a studio apartment on the 18th floor with a partial view of Darling Harbour. The studio was quite spacious and very clean with fairly basic furnishings. The building appears to have been partially refurbished as some areas, notably the shower, showed evidence of age. Like a previous reviewer we noticed the outside of the windows were dirty. Our rate included full breakfast and represented good value for money for a city centre location (2 mins form Darling Harbour). The staff were very efficient and helpful and found us a room well before normal check in time as we had arrived early in the morning. Overall an agreeable experience and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities and location”
Reviews.Author: Tom D
Reviews.Content: We were two adults and three teenagers and had linked rooms (2004 and 2005). Check in and check out were efficient and the staff seemed very pleasant and helpful. Both of our rooms had self catering facilities and were clean with everything working. Perfect for a family of 4-5. Location is good for either Darling Harbour or the CBD. Short walk to the nearest train station (Town Hall station). Parking next door is reasonably priced. All in all an above average experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel near Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: crellston
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this place for 5 nights during our year long round the world trip. It is in an excellent location close to tdarling Harbour (5 mins walk) and the CBD, It has recently been taken over by Mantra, so maybe we got a special deal at 129 AUD per night but the roon/suite was FANTASTIC! We had a very large lounge, (with full kitchen facilities), spacious bedroom, great bathroom with corner bath, a laundry room and a small study. Incredible value for money. The managers, Sam and Raymond were a great example of efficient hotel management and were really helpful. This hotel is seriously worth considering for anyone visiting the city as it offers the facilities of a 4.5* for little more than the price of a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: Kat027
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a similar property in Melbourne previously, so when I was searching for somewhere to stay in Sydney, this hotel was a natural choice. I had read the reviews on trip advisor, and thought it sounded pretty good. I contacted the hotel directly for a quote on the price of rooms for the weekend I was to be there. After being told the price, I reserved a one bedroom suite for 3 nights. Upon arrival at the hotel, I was a little unsure I had the right property, as the hotel had undergone a name change the previous week (the hotel is now called Mantra on Kent). However, after confirming with the lady at reception, I was assured I was in the correct place. Check-in was quick and fuss free, and I was also told I was being upgraded. No idea why, but I'm not complaining. I was on the 21st floor, and lift delivered me there swiftly. When I opened my door, I was surprised and extremely happy with my room. I had a washer and dryer in my huge bathroom, king size bed, oven and microwave in the kitchen, and tv, dvd player and internet cables. The view of Darling Harbour was a little obstructed by some buildings, but I could still see quite a bit. The bedroom could also be completely screened off from the rest of the apartment. There was a note on the bedside table from the room maid, with her name and a form which could be filled out with any specific requests. The mini fridge was completely stocked, and also contained a complimentary small carton of milk. Everytime I left the hotel or returned, I was greeted by staff at reception, and also asked if everything was ok with my room. Overall I could not have been happier with my experience staying at this hotel. The only tiny critisism I have would be the tea and coffee was not restocked every day, but then I didn't use it all anyway. Also, the water in the shower tended to be a bit up and down on temperature, but that was minor. I would definately stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “CBD winner”
Reviews.Author: QueenslandEmma
Reviews.Content: This hotel has improved greatly since my first visit in December. Recent changes in staff and management has ensured this hotel is now a real winner. I would recommend for the business traveller, as the apartments are spacious and well appointed. I stayed in a one bedroom apartment which had a screen partition separating the bedroom to lounge room and windows afforded great views of Darling Harbour. Full kitchen and laundry were great, but I didn't even use on this visit. Location is great for the leisure traveller too, its opposite Town Hall station and dangerously close to QVB for shopping! There is a great cafe at QVB - Jet which does a great breakfast, however the hotel restaurant has re-decorated and offers a continental buffet and hot breakfast cooked to order, so is also a good option. The hotel is within easy walking distance to Darling Harbour and we enjoyed the restaurants on the Cockle Bay side, including Nick's Seafood which is always a winner. Another restaurant close by is "Devine", cnr Market & Castlereagh (from memory) which was outstanding. The hotels lobby has been refurbished and the staff are helpful and friendly making it a great value option in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: ukdiva
Reviews.Content: Booked this a year before our stay so we got a great rate for over the New Year period. The hotel is in a great location, almost within spitting distance of Darling Harbour, and the shopping hub of QVB and George St. Circular Quay, Kings Cross and Bondi Junction are all easily accessible by train from Town Hall station which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel and the airport is 20 minutes away by train from the same station. We had a one bedroom apartment, the bedroom was an actual room as opposed to just a screened off area as in some apartments. The living room was very spacious with a double foldout bed, dining table and kitchen area. The bathroom was big enough for my needs, and was kept fully stocked by housekeeping at all times. The only downside was that we only had a dryer in our room and not a washing machine. The assistant manager did allow me to use another room to wash my clothes though so that wasn't a problem. Reception staff were hit and miss, some were fantastic, others not so much, but i don't holiday in Reception so it didn't bother me! All in all i enjoyed my stay and would consider staying there again if in town and the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “didn't like it”
Reviews.Author: iluv2travel060
Reviews.Content: overall, i would not stay there again. i never seen a bathroom sink counter so small. i couldn't put anything there. the toilet had issue where the water continuously ran. the worse was the shower. the shower head shot out water so hard that it hurts! so you need to be carefully where that water hits if you know what i mean. my girlfriend did take the warning from me and when it was her turn, she let out a yelp due to the water hitting some sensitive parts. ouchie! the staff was friendly though but the rooms were just outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Drew F
Reviews.Content: I booked a one bedroom executive suite through a last minute accommodation site for under half price and I was amazed at how perfect the suite was. We were given a room with a massive balcony (enough room to host a party) and it is a shame the weather did not permit us to use it. The suite was clean, well presented and I thoroughly enjoyed my short one-night stay. The LCD TV with DVD/CD player was a great touch, allowing us to listen to our own music. Great location with only a short walk to many highlights of the city. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: daddymac1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property for a two week business trip. It is very conveniently located, right around the corner from Darling Harbor. The room was huge, but not layed out very well. The "bedroom" is just an area that is separated by some frosted glass partitions, and only has one tv in the living room. There is another room with a table and chairs betwen the bedroom and the bathroom, but it was kind of useless. It was also kind of odd that I had a dryer but no washer. There also was no dishwasher or microwave. I stayed on the 5th floor and found the property to be quiet and comfortable. The staff was average. The balcony was very nice, and there is a really inexpensive bottle shop across the street. You can get your laundry done next door at the convenience store. They do dry cleaning or bag wash at reasonable prices. Try Sweeneys for a good Pub/Thai restaurant it is good, just a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “great spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great spot for shopping and sightseeing, everything within walking distance. Very helpful staff.Ask for a room on high floors with a view of Darling harbour. Very nice restaurant attatched to complex. rooms very modern and clean, big comfortable bed. very spacious for two.

Reviews.Title: “l love the location of this hotel reight near darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: l stayed here for a weekend back in june 2005 my afl team was playing the sydney swans l liked the barthroom of my appartment a nice big spa barth and marble floors and sink but the internet use ws expensive they didnt have many channels on the foxtel the staff was very nice when l had a late flight home when l checked out they watched my bags all day for me the bed was very cozy to sleep in and the place was very clean the cleaning lady would change ur bed sheets and towels very day

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July 2004 after checking out of another. The suites are excellent, with cooking facilities and ours even had laundry facilities. The staff were also very helpful, providing maps and directions. Although not for the budget conscious, the suites were value for money and you do get what you pay for. The location is good, across from Darling Harbour, which houses a variety of shops and also the Sydney Aquarium. Areas of the city such as the Rocks and Opera House can be reached on a bus within about 15 minutes. The main shopping areas are also only 10 minutes walk. Overall I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a facility which is clean, comfortable and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Rangitane
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night for an early flight home.2 adults and 2 kids in a 1 bedroom suite for au$155 from their home site. Modern furnishings,spotless, well appointed,small apartment- kids slept on a sofa bed.Wouldn't stay any longer with children, but great for a couple.Good location for shopping etc. Washer,dryer,dishwasher,equipped kitchen -all you'd need for a short stay at a cheap price.We came away more than happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Pacific International Suites for 4 nights (28/2/04-2/3/04). We were upgraded to the deluxe one bedroom apartment (king sized bed!) with full laundry and balcony at no extra cost. The furnishings were modern with reception staff that were helpful and friendly. The location is excellent - right next to Darling Harbour. There was a 7-11 one minute walk from the hotel where you can buy breakfast foods (no breakfast included) and you can cook it up in the fully equipped kitchen in the apartment. Circular Quay, Harbour Bridge and Opera House is ~10-15 minutes walk away with the Centrepoint Tower3 blocks away. Shopping areas (Queen Victoria Building, arcades, Pitt St Mall) are within three blocks of the hotel. Will definitely stay there on our next visit.

HotelInfo.Name: Mantra on Kent
HotelInfo.Address: 433 Kent St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
